lexs:DataItemCategory.lexs:DataItemCategoryDescription: This Data Item Package is an incident.

j:RegisteredOffender.j:RegisteredOffenderDescription: Has done bad things over and over.

j:MissingPersonLastSeenWitness.j:WitnessAccountDescriptionText: Saw missing person at the 7-Eleven on Oak Street

j:Witness.j:WitnessAccountDescriptionText: Guy jumped out and demanded money

nc:Activity.nc:ActivityDescriptionText: On March 18, 1997, Mr. Thomas C. Farr (white, male, SSN: 968526352) came into the office and indicated that he wished to renew his offender registration saying that he could not remember when it expired, but he did not want to abscond from his duties. Per procedure, I ran Mr. Farr through our system to verify his need to register. As a part of that check, I found that a warrant had been issued for Mr. Farr on a burglary offense and a flight to avoid offense. As a result of this warrant, I placed Mr. Farr under arrest. Mr. Farr indicated that he had not stolen anything in his life. He did indicate that he had recovered some things that belonged to him from his brother's residence, but that was only after many attempts to have his brother return to him what was rightfully his. He indicated that the necklace he was wearing was one of the retreived items as was a firearm later recovered from his residence. When asked about the other items listed as stolen on the theft report, Mr. Farr indicated he didn't know anything about them and insited that he only took what was his.

nc:TangibleItem.nc:ItemDescriptionText: A book about how to do something.

nc:Drug.nc:SubstanceCompositionDescriptionText: cocaine and a small amount of heroin

nc:Substance.nc:SubstanceFoundDescriptionText: Some left in bottle, most all over floor at crime scene
Stash of stolen goods in basement
